sen.j: 佐味田宝塚古墳（さみたたからづかこふん）は、奈良県北葛城郡河合町に所在する古墳時代前期後半の前方後円墳である。
sen.e: Samida Takarazuka Tumulus is a keyhole-shaped mound built in the latter half of the earlier Kofun period (tumulus period); it is located in Kawai-cho, Kitakatsuragi-gun, Nara Prefecture.
Samida Takarazuka Tumulus is a keyhole-shaped mound built in the latter half of the earlier Kofun period (tumulus period); it is located in Kawai-cho, Kitakatsuragi-gun, Nara Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 原文は「さみた」となっていますが、奈良国立博物館のリスト[http://sips03.narahaku.go.jp/exhib/2008toku/kenchiku/kenchiku-2_e.htm]の表記に従って、［Samida］でOKだと思います。不要なスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: Samida Takarazuka Tumulus is a keyhole-shaped mound built in the latter half of the earlier Kofun period (tumulus period); it is located in Kawai-cho, Kitakatsuragi-gun, Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 佐味田宝塚古墳は、奈良盆地の南西部にある馬見古墳群にある。
sen.e: Samida Takarazuka Tumulus is in the Umami burial mounds of the southwestern Nara Basin.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Samida Takarazuka Tumulus is in the Umami burial mounds of the southwestern Nara Basin.
Samida Takarazuka Tumulus is in the Umami burial mounds of the southwestern Nara Basin.

sen.j: 墳丘は前方部を北東に向け全長111.5メートル、後円部直径60メートルである。
sen.e: The front part of the tumulus is facing northeast and its total length is 111.5 meters long while the diameter of the rounded part is 60 meters long.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The front part of the tumulus is facing northeast and its total length is 111.5 meters long while the diameter of the rounded part is 60 meters long.
The front part of the tumulus is facing northeast and its total length is 111.5 meters long while the diameter of the rounded part is 60 meters long.

sen.j: 濠は確認されていない。
sen.e: No moat has been found.
No moat has been found.
No moat has been found.

sen.j: この古墳からは1882年（明治14年）に約30数面の銅鏡が出土した。
sen.e: In 1882, over 30 bronze mirrors were excavated from this tumulus.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 1882, over 30 bronze mirrors were excavated from this tumulus.
In 1882, over 30 bronze mirrors were excavated from this tumulus.

sen.j: その中に家屋文鏡（かおくもんきょう）と呼ばれている直径22.9センチの大型鏡があった。
sen.e: Among them was a large mirror (22.9 centimeters in diameter) called "Kaoku Monkyo."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Among them was a large mirror (22.9 centimeters in diameter) called "Kaoku Monkyo."
Among them was a large mirror (22.9 centimeters in diameter) called "Kaoku Monkyo."

sen.j: その鏡の文様は、この古墳に葬られた人々の居館を構成する家屋を表現したものである。
sen.e: The pattern on the mirror depicts houses where the people buried in this tumulus used to live.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The pattern on the mirror depicts houses where the people buried in this tumulus used to live.
The pattern on the mirror depicts houses where the people buried in this tumulus used to live.

sen.j: それらの家屋は、まつりごと（祭事・政事）や4世紀ごろの地域の首長の日常生活に使用されていたものと考えられている。
sen.e: These houses are considered to have been used for rituals and political affairs, or for daily life of the local leaders around the 4th century.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: These houses are considered to have been used for rituals and political affairs, or for daily life of the local leaders around the 4th century.
These houses are considered to have been used for rituals and political affairs, or for daily life of the local leaders around the 4th century.

sen.j: 1985年度に墳丘の範囲確認調査が実施された。
sen.e: In 1985, a research was conducted to verify the dimensions of the tumulus.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 1985, a research was conducted to verify the dimensions of the tumulus.
In 1985, a research was conducted to verify the dimensions of the tumulus.

sen.j: 墳丘の裾から出土した円筒埴輪列から、4世紀末から5世紀初頭頃に造られたものと考えられている。
sen.e: The tumulus is estimated to have been built between the end of the 4th century and the beginning of the 5th century, as several cylindrical haniwa (clay figure) were excavated from the foot of the tumulus.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The tumulus is estimated to have been built between the end of the 4th century and the beginning of the 5th century, as several cylindrical haniwa (clay figure) were excavated from the foot of the tumulus.

The tumulus is estimated to have been built between the end of the 4th century and the beginning of the 5th century, as several cylindrical haniwa (clay figure) were excavated from the foot of the tumulus.

sen.j: 鏡の背面には、中央にある紐（ちゅう、ひもを通す穴）を中心にそれぞれ形態を異にする四軒の家が表されている。
sen.e: On the back of the mirror are pictures representing four types of houses and chu (a hole for a cord) in the center.
On the back of the mirror are pictures representing four types of houses and chu (a hole for a cord) in the center.
On the back of the mirror are pictures representing four types of houses and chu (a hole for a cord) in the center.

sen.j: それらは、竪穴の家（A棟）、平屋建ての家（B棟）、高床の家（C棟）、高床の倉庫らしい家（D棟）である。
sen.e: The pictures are of a pit house (House A), a one-story house (House B), a raised-floor house (House C) and a house which seems to be a warehouse on stilts (House D.)
The pictures are of a pit house (House A), a one-story house (House B), a raised-floor house (House C) and a house which seems to be a warehouse on stilts (House D.)
The pictures are of a pit house (House A), a one-story house (House B), a raised-floor house (House C) and a house which seems to be a warehouse on stilts (House D.)

sen.j: A棟は、住居と見られる竪穴式住居で、入口の扉は支え棒で持ちあげられ、そこにC棟と同じ露台と蓋がみえる。
sen.e: House A is seemingly a pit dwelling with a door lifted by a column, as well as a balcony and a sunshade which are the same as those of House C.
House A is seemingly a pit dwelling with a door lifted by a column, as well as a balcony and a sunshade which are the same as those of House C.
House A is seemingly a pit dwelling with a door lifted by a column, as well as a balcony and a sunshade which are the same as those of House C.

sen.j: A棟は他の3棟よりも大きな床面積を持って表現されている。
sen.e: House A has larger floor space than other three houses.
House A has larger floor space than other three houses.
House A has larger floor space than other three houses.

sen.j: 日常生活の場を表すたものと見られる。
sen.e: This is probably because House A represents the place for daily life.
This is probably because House A represents the place for daily life.
This is probably because House A represents the place for daily life.

sen.j: このA棟と類似の竪穴式建物が奈良県天理市の東大寺山古墳から出土した鉄刀の柄の環頭に描かれている。
sen.e: A picture of a pit house which is similar to the picture of House A, is carved on the ring pommel of an iron sword excavated from Todaijiyama Tumulus in Tenri City, Nara Prefecture.
A picture of a pit house which is similar to the picture of House A, is carved on the ring pommel of an iron sword excavated from Todaijiyama Tumulus in Tenri City, Nara Prefecture.
A picture of a pit house which is similar to the picture of House A, is carved on the ring pommel of an iron sword excavated from Todaijiyama Tumulus in Tenri City, Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: B棟は、入母屋形の屋根を持つ平屋建ての家である。
sen.e: House B is a one-story house with a half-hipped roof.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: House B is a one-storey house with a half-hipped roof.
House B is a one-story house with a half-hipped roof.
sen.cmt: 米語の表記に合わすため、one-storey→one-story

sen.j: 観音開きを思わせるような壁があり、基壇の上に建てられているところから大陸風な建築の影響を受けたと見られている。
sen.e: Its wall looks like hinged double doors built on stylobate, which seems to have been influenced by the continent-style architecture.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Its wall looks like hinged double doors built on stylobate, which seems to have been influenced by the continent-style architecture.
Its wall looks like hinged double doors built on stylobate, which seems to have been influenced by the continent-style architecture.

sen.j: C棟は、高床式で入母屋型の屋根を持つ家である。
sen.e: House C is a raised-floor house with a half-hipped roof.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: House C is a raised-floor house with a half-hipped roof.
House C is a raised-floor house with a half-hipped roof.

sen.j: 一方の妻側に手すりをつけた梯子が、他方の妻側には露台が見られ、身分の高い人の家であることを示す蓋（きぬがさ、日覆い傘）がさしかけられている。
sen.e: There is a railed ladder on one side and a balcony with a sunshade (a sign of high position) on the other side of the house.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: There is a railed ladder on one side and a balcony with a sunshade (a sign of high position) on the other side of the house.
There is a railed ladder on one side and a balcony with a sunshade (a sign of high position) on the other side of the house.

sen.j: また、屋根の左右には稲妻形模様（いわゆる雷文の一種）が描かれ、その模様の中に人物像が配置されている。
sen.e: Shapes of lightning streaks (a kind of "raimon" [architectural design pattern thought to be based on flashes of lightning]) together with a portrait inside, are represented on both sides of the roof.
Shapes of lightning streaks (a kind of "raimon" [architectural design pattern thought to be based on flashes of lightning]) together with a portrait inside, are represented on both sides of the roof.
Shapes of lightning streaks (a kind of "raimon" [architectural design pattern thought to be based on flashes of lightning]) together with a portrait inside, are represented on both sides of the roof.

sen.j: 祭祀儀礼や政治を行う中心になる建物であったろうと考えられる。
sen.e: This building is considered to have been a center for rituals or political affairs.
This building is considered to have been a center for rituals or political affairs.
This building is considered to have been a center for rituals or political affairs.

sen.j: このC棟によく似た家形埴輪が大阪府八尾市の美園古墳の周濠から出土している。
sen.e: House-shaped haniwa similar to this House C was excavated from the surrounding moat of Misono Tumulus in Yao City, Osaka Prefecture.
House-shaped haniwa similar to this House C was excavated from the surrounding moat of Misono Tumulus in Yao City, Osaka Prefecture.
House-shaped haniwa similar to this House C was excavated from the surrounding moat of Misono Tumulus in Yao City, Osaka Prefecture.

sen.j: D棟は、高床式の切り妻型屋根を持つ家で、一方に梯子がある。
sen.e: House D is a raised-floor house with a gabled roof and a ladder on one side of the house.
House D is a raised-floor house with a gabled roof and a ladder on one side of the house.
House D is a raised-floor house with a gabled roof and a ladder on one side of the house.

sen.j: 高床の下は蓆様の仕切りが壁をつくり、収納空間をつくっている。
sen.e: There is a storage space with a partition made of straws under the raised-floor.
There is a storage space with a partition made of straws under the raised-floor.
There is a storage space with a partition made of straws under the raised-floor.

sen.j: このうち平屋建ての家（B）と、高床の家（D）には、その左右に木の表現があるのは神木と考えられる。
sen.e: Among the four, the one-story house (B) and the raised-floor house (D) have trees on both sides of the house, which are thought to be shinboku (sacred tree.)
Among the four, the one-storey house (B) and the raised-floor house (D) have trees on both sides of the house, which are thought to be shinboku (sacred tree).
sen.cmt: storeyに訂正しました。ピリオドの位置を訂正しました。
sen.e: Among the four, the one-story house (B) and the raised-floor house (D) have trees on both sides of the house, which are thought to be shinboku (sacred tree).
sen.cmt: 米語の表記に合わすため、one-storey→one-story

sen.j: 他の2軒はりっぱな家だが、神木がない。
sen.e: Other two are fine houses but they do not have shinboku.
Other two are fine houses but they do not have shinboku.
Other two are fine houses but they do not have shinboku.

sen.j: そのかわり、身分の高い人の家を示す入り口に立てかけられた日覆いの傘（蓋）がある。
sen.e: Instead, there are sun shades placed against the doors, which shows that the houses belong to someone of high rank.
Instead, there are sun shades placed against the doors, which shows that the houses belong to someone of high rank.
Instead, there are sun shades placed against the doors, which shows that the houses belong to someone of high rank.

sen.j: A棟を除く3棟の上には、それぞれ二羽の鳥が表されている。
sen.e: Three houses except House A have two birds on each of them.
Three houses except House A have two birds on each of them.
Three houses except House A have two birds on each of them.

tit.j: 家屋文と類似の家形埴輪
tit.e: House-shaped haniwa similar to Kaoku Monkyo pattern
House-shaped haniwa similar to Kaoku Monkyo pattern
House-shaped haniwa similar to Kaoku Monkyo pattern

sen.j: 家屋文と類似する家形埴輪が各地から出土している。
sen.e: House-shaped haniwa similar to Kaoku Monkyo pattern are excavated from different parts of Japan.
House-shaped haniwa similar to Kaoku Monkyo pattern are excavated from different parts of Japan.
House-shaped haniwa similar to Kaoku Monkyo pattern are excavated from different parts of Japan.

sen.j: 埴輪では千葉県山武郡芝山町の殿部田（とのべた）1号墳や鳥取県東伯郡羽合町の馬ノ山古墳群中の長瀬高浜遺跡から古墳時代中期の様々なスタイルをした家形埴輪が、 出土している。
sen.e: Various house-shaped haniwa of the mid Kofun period (tumulus period) were excavated from Tonobeta number 1 mound in Shibayama-cho, Sanbu County, Chiba Prefecture and Nagase Takahama site in Umanoyama burial mounds located in Hawai-cho, Tohaku County, Tottori Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 「〜町」の「Town」を文書内統一のため「-cho」にしました
sen.e: Various house-shaped haniwa of the mid Kofun period (tumulus period) were excavated from Tonobeta number 1 mound in Shibayama-cho, Sanbu County, Chiba Prefecture and Nagase Takahama site in Umanoyama burial mounds located in Hawai-cho, Tohaku County, Tottori Prefecture.

Various house-shaped haniwa of the mid Kofun period (tumulus period) were excavated from Tonobeta number 1 mound in Shibayama-cho, Sanbu County, Chiba Prefecture and Nagase Takahama site in Umanoyama burial mounds located in Hawai-cho, Tohaku County, Tottori Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 芝山町は「しばやままち」なのでShibayama-cho→Shibayama-machiとしました。

sen.j: 大阪府八尾市の美園古墳の周濠からA棟によく似た家形埴輪が、群馬県伊勢崎市赤堀町の赤堀茶臼山古墳から多種多様な8棟の家形埴輪が出土している。
sen.e: House-shaped haniwa which looks similar to House A was excavated from the surrounding moat of Misono Tumulus in Yao City, Osaka Prefecture, and eight different types of house-shaped haniwa were excavated from Akabori Chausuyama Tumulus in Akabori-cho, Isesaki City, Gunma Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 「〜町」の「Town」を文書内統一のため「-cho」にしました
sen.e: House-shaped haniwa which looks similar to House A was excavated from the surrounding moat of Misono Tumulus in Yao City, Osaka Prefecture, and eight different types of house-shaped haniwa were excavated from Akabori Chausuyama Tumulus in Akabori-cho, Isesaki City, Gunma Prefecture.

House-shaped haniwa which looks similar to House A was excavated from the surrounding moat of Misono Tumulus in Yao City, Osaka Prefecture, and eight different types of house-shaped haniwa were excavated from Akabori Chausuyama Tumulus in Akabori-machi, Isesaki City, Gunma Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 赤堀町は「あかぼりまち」なので、 Akabori-cho→ Akabori-machiとしました。
